GapFillInput.Instruction: Type a phrase from the pool into the correct space.

Content.Question:
Odd Jobs
‘When she was in her early twenties, my girlfriend, Lucy, used to design
chocolates. She loved her job because she was allowed to have as
many chocolates as she wanted. Unfortunately, she couldn't bring
any home. She says nowadays chocolates make her feel sick.’ Ben
‘In 1999 I worked as a full-time Queen Elizabeth I actor in a museum in
York. I had to wear very old-fashioned, heavy dresses and
people could take photos of themselves with me if they wanted.’ Sally
‘I met my husband Richard in France. I was working as a waitress and he was there picking mushrooms. He didn't have to work hard but the mushrooms were kept in the dark and they smelt terrible. By the end of the day, so did Richard! He wasn't allowed to eat with us until he’d had a very long shower!’ Carrie
‘When I was ten I acted as one of the two children in Mary Poppins in a London theatre. There were eight of us children altogether and we were only allowed to be on stage twice a week. The acting was great but we weren't allowed to miss our lessons and we had to take exams at the end of the year.’ Mark
